King song)|Stand By Me]]," on which they based the song "[[Dildaara-Stand by me (Ra.One song)|Dildaara]]."<ref name=TOI /> The soundtrack contains fifteen tracks, including seven original songs, four remixes, three instrumentals and an international version of "Chammak Challo".<ref name=TOI /> The music rights were bought by [[Super Cassettes Industries T-Series|T-Series]] for {{INRConvert|150|m}}.<ref name=Production /> The Hindi version of the soundtrack was released on 12 September 2011; the Tamil and Telugu versions were released on 10 October 2011, featuring six tracks each.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thehindu.com/life-and-style/metroplus/article2525656.ece |author=Kamath, Sudhish |publisher=''[[The Hindu]]'' |title=When G.One took Chitti's help |date=10 October 2011 |accessdate=11 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/678mDLbQ4?url=http://www.thehindu.com/life-and-style/metroplus/article2525656.ece |archivedate=23 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
==Release==
===Statistics=== In India, the Hindi version of ''Ra.One'' was released across more than 4,000 plus screens worldwide- 3,100 screens in 2,100 theatres, breaking the record for the widest Bollywood release previously held by ''[[Bodyguard (2011 Hindi film)|Bodyguard]]'' (2011).<ref name=Record>{{cite news |url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3582 |publisher=Box Office India |title=''Ra.One'' to hit 3,500 screens in India |date=20 October 2011 |accessdate=20 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679twoELy?url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3582 |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/raone-gets-rs-52crore-promotional-push/193103-62.html |title='Ra.One' gets Rs 52-crore promotional push |publisher=Ibnlive.in.com |date=14 October 2011 |accessdate=10 August 2013}}</ref> The Tamil and Telugu versions were released on 275 prints and 125 prints respectively.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/news-by-industry/media/entertainment-/entertainment/bollywood-learning-new-languages-for-the-south/articleshow/10877082.cms |title=Bollywood learning new languages for the South |publisher=''The Economic Times'' |accessdate=26 November 2011 |date=26 November 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679uBgyBb?url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2011-11-26/news/30444484_1_hindi-film-film-markets-cinema-halls |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> A week before the release, [[Multiplex (cinema)#India|multiplex]] owners throughout India decided to allot 95% of the total available screen space to the film.<ref>{{cite web|title=''Ra.One'': Shahrukh Khan's latest movie gets 95 per cent of shows across multiplexes |url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/news-by-industry/media/entertainment-/entertainment/ra-one-shah-rukh-khans-latest-movie-gets-95-per-cent-of-shows-across-multiplexes/articleshow/10425263.cms |author=Lalwani, Vickey |accessdate=20 October 2011 |publisher=''The Economic Times'' |date=20 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679uG9Vrw?url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2011-10-20/news/30301646_1_multiplex-owners-raone-ra-one-songs |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Overseas, ''Ra.One'' was released in 904 prints.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/SRK-s-RA-One-earns-Rs-170-crore-at-BO/Article1-763262.aspx |title=SRK's RA.One earns Rs 170 crore at BO |publisher=Hindustan Times |date=31 October 2011 |accessdate=10 August 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131211132858/http://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/bollywood/srk-s-ra-one-earns-rs-170-crore-at-bo/article1-763262.aspx |archivedate=11 December 2013 |df= }}</ref> This including 600 prints in Germany, 344 prints in the USA, 200–300 prints in South Korea, 202 prints in the UK, 79 prints in the Middle East, 75 prints in Russia, 51 prints in Australia, 49 prints in Canada and 25 prints in New Zealand and Taiwan.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/bollywood/box-office/2011/ra-one-beat-bodyguard-international-box-office-281011.html|publisher=Oneindia|title=SRK's ''Ra.One'' beats ''Bodyguard'' at international box office|date=28 October 2011|accessdate=18 April 2013}}</ref> In early October 2011, a partnership deal was being finalised by the distributors to allow the film to be released in China across 1,000 prints.<ref name=Digital /> In addition, the film was released in Pakistan and non-traditional territories like Brazil, Spain, Italy, Greece and Hong Kong.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://entertainment.onepakistan.com.pk/news/movie/1956-superhero-ra-one-flying-high-with-rs-170-crore-collection.html|publisher=One Pakistan|title=Superhero ''Ra.One'' flying high with Rs. 170 crore collection|date=31 October 2011|accessdate=18 April 2013}}</ref> The 3D version was released in 550 screens across the world.<ref name=Record /> ''Ra.One'' was noted for the extensive use of digital prints, reportedly making up 50–60% of the total release;<ref name=Digital>{{cite web|url=http://www.medianama.com/2011/10/223-shah-rukh-khan-digital-cinema-ra-one/ |author=Pahwa, Nikhil |publisher=MediaNama |title=Shahrukh Khan: could never release ''Ra.One'' in 3,500 prints if not for digital; 50–60% digital prints |date=7 October 2011 |accessdate=17 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679u7aP5u?url=http://www.medianama.com/2011/10/223-shah-rukh-khan-digital-cinema-ra-one/ |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> in India, the film was exhibited in over 1,300 [[Digital cinema|digital theatres]], breaking the record previously held by ''Bodyguard''.<ref name=Record /> The wide digital release was implemented to lower distribution costs, make the film accessible to a wider audience and reduce piracy.<ref name=Digital /> However, despite the measures taken, [[Pirated goods|pirated versions]] of ''Ra.One'' were available on the Internet within hours of the film's release.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.businessofcinema.com/news.php?newsid=19337 |title=Shahrukh Khan's ''Ra.One'' succumbs to piracy |publisher=Business of Cinema |date=27 October 2011 |accessdate=20 April 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679uE4zUh?url=http://www.businessofcinema.com/news.php?newsid=19337 |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
===Marketing=== [[File:Antagonist Ra.One.jpg|thumb|right|''Ra.One''{{'}}s poster featuring Arjun Rampal. This look was kept in secrecy throughout the production of the film until release.]] The producers of ''Ra.One'' spent {{INRConvert|100|m}} out of a {{INRConvert|520|m}} marketing budget,<ref name=Promotion>{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/ra-one-to-have-bollywood-s-longest-promotion-news-bollywood-ljvknXcgjcb.html |title=Bollywood's longest promotion |author=Bhat, Varada |date=19 September 2011 |work=[[Business Standard]] |publisher=Sify |accessdate=3 May 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67NlQpBTq?url=http://www.sify.com/movies/ra-one-to-have-bollywood-s-longest-promotion-news-bollywood-ljvknXcgjcb.html |archivedate= 3 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> {{INRConvert|150|m}} of this was utilised for internet promotions alone.<ref>{{cite video|url=http://www.ndtv.com/video/player/news/i-ra-one-i-s-rampage/213695 |publisher=NDTV |title=Ra.One ''rampage'' |date=14 October 2011 |accessdate=20 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679sZFtSw?url=http://www.ndtv.com/video/player/news/i-ra-one-i-s-rampage/213695 |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The film's first theatrical poster was released in December 2010,<ref name=Reuters /> and was followed by the release of two teaser trailers during the [[2011 ICC Cricket World Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|title=''Ra.One'' first look to be unveiled today during World Cup telecast |url=http://oldbh.bollywoodhungama.com/news/2011/03/23/15531/index.html |publisher=Bollywood Hungama |accessdate=23 March 2011 |author=Tuteja, Joginder |date=23 March 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679si1WJ8?url=http://oldbh.bollywoodhungama.com/news/2011/03/23/15531/index.html |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The first theatrical trailer premiered three months later.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/selling-ra.one/864405/2 |title=Selling ''Ra.One'' |publisher=''The Indian Express'' |date=24 October 2011 |accessdate=12 May 2012 |author=Pereira, Priyanka |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67bUGaoNm?url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/selling-ra.one/864405/2 |archivedate=12 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Khan and Sinha undertook a multi-city tour during which they unveiled a 3,600 feet-long piece of fan mail to collect audience messages.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.businessofcinema.com/news.php?newsid=18423 |title=Big Cinemas launches longest travelling fan mail for Shahrukh Khan's ''Ra.One'' |publisher=Business of Cinema |date=2 June 2011 |accessdate=20 April 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679skgmQL?url=http://www.businessofcinema.com/news.php?newsid=18423 |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The official website of ''Ra.One'' was launched on 31 May 2011, and an official YouTube channel for the film was subsequently unveiled.<ref name=Marketing>{{cite news|url=http://businesstoday.intoday.in/story/srks-superhero-power-turning-ra.one-to-marketing-gold/1/18952.html |title=SRK's superhero power: turning ''Ra.One'' to marketing gold |author=S, Anusha |date=27 September 2011 |publisher=''Business Today'' |accessdate=3 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679sfz2Hm?url=http://businesstoday.intoday.in/story/srks-superhero-power-turning-ra.one-to-marketing-gold/1/18952.html |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> On 20 October 2011, Khan held a live chat with fans on [[Google Plus]], the first time an Indian film personality had done so.<ref>{{cite web|title=Shahrukh meets fans on Google Plus Hangout for ''Ra.One'' chat |url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/shah-rukh-to-meet-fans-on-google-plus-hangout/194855-8.html |publisher=CNN-IBN |accessdate=20 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679sytPye?url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/shah-rukh-to-meet-fans-on-google-plus-hangout/194855-8.html |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Rampal's look in the film, which had been kept secret,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/bollywood/gupshup/2011/shahrukh-khan-arjun-rampal-ra-one-060811.html |publisher=Oneindia.in |title=Shahrukh hiding Arjun's look in ''Ra.One'' |date=6 August 2011 |accessdate=10 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679t1uWNX?url=http://www.robotstxt.org/ |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> was revealed in late October 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report_arjun-rampal-comes-clean-on-friction-with-shah-rukh-khan_1601951 |author=Mahadevan, Sneha |publisher=''Daily News and Analysis'' |title=Arjun Rampal comes clean on "friction" with Shahrukh Khan |date=22 October 2011 |accessdate=22 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679tAooc4?url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report_arjun-rampal-comes-clean-on-friction-with-shah-rukh-khan_1601951 |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
The film's marketing utilised merchandise and games to facilitate the creation of a franchise.<ref name=Gaming>{{cite web |url=http://www.afaqs.com/news/story.html?sid=31521_Indias+first+social+game+for+Ra.One |title=India's first social game for ''Ra.One'' |author=Shinde, Shivani |date=30 August 2011 |work=Business Standard |publisher=Afaqs! |accessdate=3 May 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67NlCb72z?url=http://www.afaqs.com/news/story.html?sid=31521_Indias+first+social+game+for+Ra.One |archivedate=3 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Khan marketed merchandise related to the film,<ref>{{cite web|title=''Ra.One'': exclusive and authentic movie merchandise |url=http://raone.seventymm.com/ |publisher=Seventymm |accessdate=20 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679tZAQXl?url=http://raone.seventymm.com/ |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> which included toys, [[tablet computer|tablets]] and apparel.<ref name=promdr>{{cite web|url=http://www.outlookindia.com/article.aspx?278623 |publisher=''Outlook'' |title=G.One, with the wind |date=24 October 2011 |accessdate=18 November 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67AD4T0Ml?url=http://www.outlookindia.com/article.aspx?278623 |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> On 14 October 2011, a gaming tournament featuring games like ''[[Call of Duty]]'' was conducted in Mumbai and telecast live on YouTube.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.businessofcinema.com/news.php?newsid=19219/ |title=Shahrukh Khan to battle with gamers at ''Ra.One'' NVIDIA GeForce LAN |publisher=Business of Cinema |date=14 October 2011 |accessdate=14 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679tLNoCx?url=http://www.businessofcinema.com/news.php?newsid=19219%2F |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Red Chillies Entertainment partnered with [[Sony Computer Entertainment|Sony Computer Entertainment Europe]] to create "Ra.One – ''The Game''," a game for [[PlayStation]]s which was released on 5 October 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/tech/hardware/playstation-launches-game-on-srk-flick-ra-one/articleshow/10249194.cms |title=PlayStation launches game on SRK flick ''Ra.One'' |work=Press Trust of India |date=5 October 2011 |publisher=''[[The Economic Times]]'' |accessdate=5 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679tGDl9J?url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2011-10-05/news/30246976_1_playstation2-playstation3-sony-computer-entertainment-europe |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The producers further collaborated with [[UTV Software Communications|UTV Indiagames]] to design a social game titled ''Ra.One Genesis'', with an independent plot based on G.One,<ref name=Gaming /> in addition to designing digital comics based on the film's characters.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/news-by-industry/et-cetera/if-we-dont-evolve-in-10-years-we-will-lose-indian-audience-shahrukh-khan/articleshow/9962913.cms |author=Raghavendra, Nandini |title=Indian cinema must evolve; ''Ra.One'' not urban centric: Shahrukh Khan |date=13 September 2011 |publisher=''[[The Economic Times]]'' |accessdate=13 September 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679teZZ1f?url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2011-09-13/news/30149445_1_indian-cinema-raone-film |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
===Screenings=== In May 2011, the first [[dailies|rushes]] of ''Ra.One'' were shown to the cast of Khan's other home production ''[[Always Kabhi Kabhi]]'' (2011).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mid-day.com/entertainment/2011/may/260511-Shah-Rukh-Khan-Always-Kabhi-Kabhi-Ra-One.htm |title=''Always Kabhi Kabhi'' cast gets a sneak peek into ''Ra.One'' |publisher=''Mid-Day'' |date=26 May 2011 |accessdate=20 April 2012 |author=KBR, Uppala |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/678hyQ68A?url=http://www.mid-day.com/entertainment/2011/may/260511-Shah-Rukh-Khan-Always-Kabhi-Kabhi-Ra-One.htm |archivedate=23 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Subsequently, the film was screened for test audiences to study and gauge the film's appeal across different age groups.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.medianama.com/2011/10/223-shah-rukh-khan-there-needs-to-be-more-film-based-digital-content-would-like-to-keep-ra-one-alive-on-digital/|publisher=Medianama|title=Shahrukh Khan: There needs to be more film-based digital content; would like to keep ''Ra.One'' alive on digital|author=Pahwa, Nikhil|date=5 October 2011|accessdate=18 April 2013}}</ref> A few days prior to the theatrical release, Khan arranged a special screening of the film's final cut in Yash Raj Studios, where he invited close friends, his family and the film's crew.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.businessofcinema.com/news.php?newsid=19307 |title=''Iron Man'' VFX are nothing in front of ''Ra.One'' VFX – first audience reaction |publisher=Business of Cinema |date=24 October 2011 |accessdate=3 May 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67Nb3IdW1?url=http://www.businessofcinema.com/news.php?newsid=19307 |archivedate= 3 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Between 24 and 26 October 2011, ''Ra.One'' had international premieres in Dubai, London and Toronto, all of which were chosen due to their international significance and large South Asian populations.<ref name=prem>{{cite web |url=http://www.magnamags.com/content/view/8489/105/lang,english/ |publisher=''[[Stardust (magazine)|Stardust]]'' |title=Shahrukh ''Ra.One'' to premiere in London, New York, Dubai, Toronto!! |author=Rai, K.K |date=27 September 2011 |accessdate=5 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679thGSnj?url=http://www.magnamags.com/content/view/8489/105/lang,english/ |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The premiere in Dubai was held on 24 October 2011 at the Grand Cinemas, [[Wafi City|Wafi]]. A high-profile dinner and charity auction followed, where Khan raised [[United Arab Emirates dirham|AED]]30,000 (approximately US$8,200) to build a workshop for children with special needs.<ref>{{cite web|title=SRK raises Dh30,000 for special needs children |url=http://www.thenational.ae/news/uae-news/srk-raises-dh30-000-for-special-needs-children |date=25 October 2011 |publisher=''The National'' |accessdate=25 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679tlgajr?url=http://www.thenational.ae/news/uae-news/srk-raises-dh30-000-for-special-needs-children |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The premiere included three simultaneous screenings of the film, for which tickets were placed on sale for the public.<ref>{{cite web|title=Shahrukh's ''Ra.One'' breaks Mideast record |url=http://www.internationalreporter.com/News-7783/shah-rukhs-ra-one-breaks-mideast-record.html |date=20 October 2011 |publisher=International Reporter |accessdate=18 April 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130515124555/http://www.internationalreporter.com/News-7783/shah-rukhs-ra-one-breaks-mideast-record.html |archivedate=15 May 2013 |df= }}</ref> The premiere in London took place at the [[The O2 Arena (London)|O<sub>2</sub> Cineworld]] the following day, and the premiere in Toronto took place at the [[TIFF Bell Lightbox]] on 26 October 2011.<ref>{{cite web|title=Bollywood star Shahrukh Khan brings ''Ra.One'' to Toronto |url=http://ca.omg.yahoo.com/blogs/north-stars/bollywood-star-shah-rukh-khan-brings-ra-one-182544537.html |date=27 October 2011 |publisher=[[Yahoo!]] |accessdate=27 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679tp4KIH?url=http://ca.omg.yahoo.com/blogs/north-stars/bollywood-star-shah-rukh-khan-brings-ra-one-182544537.html |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
''Ra.One'' was submitted to the [[Central Board of Film Certification]] on 14 October 2011 to receive its viewership rating. The Board raised strong objections to the film's action scenes, fearing that they would influence young children to emulate the stunts. The police and the [[Indian Railways]] security force had made similar objections to the train-based stunts in the film, claiming that youngsters would "blindly imitate them" and hence put their lives at risk.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report_ra-one-rubs-mumbai-s-railway-cops-the-wrong-way_1606199 |title=''Ra.One'' rubs Mumbai's railway cops the wrong way |publisher=''Daily News and Analysis'' |date=2 November 2011 |accessdate=10 March 2012 |author=Aklekar, Rajendra |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679yJ0S2F?url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report_ra-one-rubs-mumbai-s-railway-cops-the-wrong-way_1606199 |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The film was finally passed with a [[U (Central Board of Film Certification)|'U' certificate]] without cuts, but under the condition that prominent disclaimers were shown, stating that the stunts were computer-generated and should not be imitated.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.in.com/news/entertainment/raonepasses-the-censor-board-scrutiny-but-20954029-in-1.html |title=''Ra.One'' passes the Censor Board scrutiny, but .. |publisher=In.com |work=Mid-Day |date=17 October 2011 |accessdate=15 April 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679yFw5cc?url=http://www.in.com/news/entertainment/raonepasses-the-censor-board-scrutiny-but-20954029-in-1.html |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The [[British Board of Film Classification]] rated the film [[British Board of Film Classification#Current certificates|12A]] for "moderate fantasy violence".<ref name=brate /> In March 2012, a ''[[Mid-Day]]'' report alleged that ''Ra.One'' had received a favourable rating, pointing out that the producers had violated the rules by meeting the Board officials during the screening.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mid-day.com/entertainment/2012/mar/170312-Bollywood-Change-in-Censor-Board-panel-irks-Bollywood.htm |title=Change in Censor Board panel irks Bollywood |publisher=''Mid-Day'' |date=17 March 2012 |accessdate=18 March 2012 |author=Kotwani, Hiren |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679yLxlvp?url=http://www.mid-day.com/entertainment/2012/mar/170312-Bollywood-Change-in-Censor-Board-panel-irks-Bollywood.htm |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
===Plagiarism allegations=== The film faced allegations of plagiarism with similarities to ''[[Terminator 2: Judgment Day]]'' (1991), the ''[[Batman in film#Christopher Nolan trilogy|Batman]]'' series, ''[[Iron Man (2008 film)|Iron Man]]'' (2008), ''[[The Sorcerer's Apprentice (2010 film)|The Sorcerer's Apprentice]]'' (2010) and ''[[Tron: Legacy]]'' (2010).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/slide-show/slide-show-1-raones-inspirations/20110919.htm |title=Has ''Ra.One'' been inspired from this? |publisher=Rediff |date=19 September 2011 |accessdate=27 April 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67EVB1kKl?url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/slide-show/slide-show-1-raones-inspirations/20110919.htm |archivedate=27 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=''Ra.One'' includes a tribute to Rajinikanth |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/RA-One-includes-a-tribute-to-Rajinikanth/Article1-745104.aspx |work=[[Press Trust of India]] |publisher=''[[Hindustan Times]]'' |accessdate=13 September 2011 |date=13 September 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679yUfzf5?url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/RA-One-includes-a-tribute-to-Rajinikanth/Article1-745104.aspx |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Khan denied the allegations, saying, "I got inspired from a lot of superhero movies but the movie is original. In fact, ''Ra.One'' will be the first superhero-based movie in the world in which the superhero lives in a family."<ref>{{cite web|work=Indo-Asian News Service |url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/raone-superhero-is-a-family-man-says-srk/193359-8-66.html |publisher=CNN-IBN |title=''Ra.One'' superhero is a family man, says SRK |date=14 October 2011 |accessdate=15 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67NjpCj1u?url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/raone-superhero-is-a-family-man-says-srk/193359-8-66.html |archivedate= 3 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
A few days before the release, screenwriter Yash Patnaik claimed that ''Ra.One'' resembled a concept that he had developed several years before. Patnaik appealed to the [[Bombay High Court]] to delay the film's release, until he was given due credit or 10% of the film's overall profit.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-10-21/mumbai/30305855_1_tv-writer-advocates-copyright |author=Thomas, Shibu |title=TV writer seeks stay on ''Ra.One'' |publisher=''The Times of India'' |date=21 October 2011 |accessdate=21 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679yaDj8T?url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-10-21/mumbai/30305855_1_tv-writer-advocates-copyright |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The court, observing ''prima facie'' evidence that there had been copyright violations, asked the filmmakers to deposit {{INRConvert|10|m}} with the court on 21 October 2011 before releasing the film. However, Patnaik challenged the court's decision and demanded that the producers give him credit and not cash.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.enewsgulf.com/entertainment/entertainment-news/bollywood/492-shahrukh-to-pay-one-crore-to-lift-ban-on-raone |title=Shahrukh to pay Rs. 1 crore to lift a ban on ''Ra.One'' |publisher=''e-News Gulf'' |date=22 October 2011 |accessdate=23 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679yckYQt?url=http://www.enewsgulf.com/entertainment/entertainment-news/bollywood/492-shahrukh-to-pay-one-crore-to-lift-ban-on-raone |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Sinha later claimed that he alone had developed the film's story.<ref>{{cite web |title=I developed the original story of ''Ra.One'': Anubhav Sinha |author=Baksi, Dibyojyoti |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/I-developed-the-original-story-of-RA-One-Anubhav-Sinha/Article1-760936.aspx |publisher=''Hindustan Times'' |date=24 October 2011 |accessdate=24 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679yejFQD?url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/I-developed-the-original-story-of-RA-One-Anubhav-Sinha/Article1-760936.aspx |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
===Hacking=== ''Ra.One'' also faced cybertheft and hacking issues. On 3 June 2011, three days after its launch, the official website of the film was hacked by suspected Pakistani cyber criminals who stated that the act was in revenge for a similar attack on a [[Karachi]] press club website. The hackers defaced the homepage and left a note threatening the Indian Press Club.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report_shah-rukh-khan-s-ra-one-websites-hacked_1550520 |author=Singh, Divyesh |title=Shahrukh Khan's ''Ra.One'' website hacked |publisher=''[[Daily News and Analysis]]'' |date=3 June 2011 |accessdate=15 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679yWr6js?url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report_shah-rukh-khan-s-ra-one-websites-hacked_1550520 |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Despite precautions, the song "Chammak Challo" was leaked several months before the official release of the soundtrack. Khan clarified that the leaked song was a "rough version" of the actual song, and that the person responsible for the leak was being looked for. He subsequently refuted claims that the leak had been engineered as a publicity stunt.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-06-02/news-interviews/29608972_1_leak-chammak-challo-song |title=SRK upset over Chammak Challo leak |publisher=''The Times of India'' |date=2 June 2011 |accessdate=27 April 2012 |author=Sharma, Smrity |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67F2tGrx7?url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-06-02/news-interviews/29608972_1_leak-chammak-challo-song |archivedate=27 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
===Television and home media=== The television broadcasting rights for ''Ra.One'' were bought by [[STAR (India)|Star India]] for a then-record sum of {{INRConvert|350|m}}, surpassing ''[[3 Idiots]]'' (2009).<ref name=Hint>{{cite web|title=''Ra.One'' will make Rs. 100 crore in a week |author=Dubey, Rachana |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/RA-One-will-make-Rs-100-crore-in-a-week/Article1-759816.aspx |date=21 October 2011 |accessdate=29 February 2012 |publisher=''Hindustan Times'' |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/65nuGPrMO?url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/RA-One-will-make-Rs-100-crore-in-a-week/Article1-759816.aspx |archivedate=29 February 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The Indian television premiere of ''Ra.One'' took place on 21 January 2012 on [[STAR Gold]], garnering a 28% market sharefor the channel and a TVR of 6.7.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiantelevision.com/headlines/y2k12/jan/jan206.php |publisher=IndianTelevision.com |title=''Ra.One'' signals upward ratings trend of big movies on TV |date=27 January 2012 |accessdate=30 January 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679xlzQ1x?url=http://www.indiantelevision.com/headlines/y2k12/jan/jan206.php |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Star India subsequently syndicated the television screening rights to [[Disney XD]], where it premiered on 2 June 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiantelevision.com/headlines/y2k12/may/may272.php |title=Star syndicates ''Ra.One'' airing rights to Disney XD |publisher=Indian Television |date=31 May 2012 |accessdate=9 June 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/68INsydYL?url=http://www.indiantelevision.com/headlines/y2k12/may/may272.php |archivedate= 9 June 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> In May 2012, [[International Media Distribution]] announced that ''Ra.One'' would be televised on [[Comcast|Comcast and Cox]], as a part of the celebrations of the [[Asian Pacific American Heritage Month]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.onscreenasia.com/article/cable-subscribers-to-get-free-asian-movies-music-in-celebration-of-apahm/9798 |title=Cable subscribers to get free Asian movies, music in celebration of APAHM |publisher=Asia OnScreen |date=7 May 2012 |accessdate=26 May 2012 |author=Las Marias, Stephen |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67x4keI7I?url=http://www.onscreenasia.com/article/cable-subscribers-to-get-free-asian-movies-music-in-celebration-of-apahm/9798 |archivedate=26 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> [[Discovery Channel]] tied up with Red Chillies Entertainment to produce a one-hour program titled "''Revealed: The Making of Ra.One''," which aired on the channel on 30 March 2012. The program discussed the making of the film in detail, including the visual effects and the challenges faced while filming.<ref name=vfx% />
Eros International released the DVD of ''Ra.One'' on 13 December 2011 across all regions in one-disc and two-disc packs complying with the [[NTSC]] format.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/Ra-One-Hindi-Bollywood-Indian-Cinema/dp/B0063V696O |title=''Ra.One'' (2011) (Hindi movie / Bollywood film / Indian cinema DVD) |publisher=Amazon |date=13 December 2011 |accessdate=4 April 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679xsgURS?url=http://www.amazon.com/Ra-One-Hindi-Bollywood-Indian-Cinema/dp/B0063V696O |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The DVD of the film contained [[alternate ending]]s. Initially, Khan had wanted to add alternate endings to the theatrical release itself, but later deemed it risky. The DVD version was made interactive as well.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mid-day.com/entertainment/2011/feb/100211-Ra-One-DVDs-feature-alternate-endings.htm |title=''Ra.One'' DVDs to feature alternate endings |publisher=''Mid-Day'' |date=2 October 2011 |accessdate=4 April 2012 |author=Joshi, Tushar |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679y0XVxA?url=http://www.mid-day.com/entertainment/2011/feb/100211-Ra-One-DVDs-feature-alternate-endings.htm |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> VCD and [[Blu-Ray]] versions of the film were also released.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.flipkart.com/ra-one-movie/p/itmd488fxggzepng?pid=AVMD487XHQXR6NMN |title=''Ra-One'' (Movie, VCD) |publisher=Flipkart |accessdate=4 April 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679y4jT82?url=http://www.flipkart.com/ra-one-movie/p/itmd488fxggzepng?pid=AVMD487XHQXR6NMN |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.flipkart.com/ra-one-movie/p/itmd488fxggzepng?pid=AVMD4JPXNV3EWDGG |title=''Ra-One'' (Movie, Blu-ray) |publisher=Flipkart |accessdate=4 April 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/679y9Vysg?url=http://www.flipkart.com/ra-one-movie/p/itmd488fxggzepng?pid=AVMD4JPXNV3EWDGG |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
==Reception== {{Main|List of awards received by Ra.One}} Upon release, ''Ra.One'' received mixed reviews from critics in India<ref name="HTX">{{cite web|title=Critics' verdict: ''Ra.One'' gets mixed reviews |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/Critics-verdict-RA-One-gets-mixed-reviews/Article1-761773.aspx |accessdate=27 October 2011 |publisher=''Hindustan Times'' |date=27 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/676XZV2Rv?url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/Critics-verdict-RA-One-gets-mixed-reviews/Article1-761773.aspx |archivedate=22 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> and generally positive reviews overseas. Review aggregate website [[Rotten Tomatoes]] reported that 67% of 21 critics gave ''Ra.One'' a positive review, with an average critic rating of 5.6/10, granting the film a "Fresh" consensus.<ref name="Rev1">{{cite web|title=''Ra.One''|url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/ra_one_2011/|accessdate=29 September 2015|publisher=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|date=23 February 2012}}</ref> On [[Metacritic]], which assigns a [[weighted mean]] from film reviews, ''Ra.One'' holds a rating of 60% based on eight reviews, signifying "mixed or average reviews."<ref>{{cite web|title=''Ra.One''|publisher=Metacritic|year=2011|accessdate=29 September 2015|url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/ra-one}}</ref>
{{quote box|width=26em|align=right|quote="Some of the scenes are surely entertaining but when one goes to watch a SRK film, one hopes to be entertained throughout, and sadly ''Ra.One'' fails to do so."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/bollywood/review-ra-one-not-your-usual-srk-film_99089.htm |publisher=Zee News |title=Review: ''Ra.One''– not your usual SRK film |date=26 October 2011 |accessdate=26 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6779GSRyu?url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/bollywood/review-ra-one-not-your-usual-srk-film_99089.htm |archivedate=22 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{Rating|2|5}}</ref>|source=—[[Zee News]] review; contrarily, several other reviews praised the film's entertainment value.<ref>{{cite web |title=''Ra.One'' |author=Kazmi, Nikhat |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/movie-reviews/hindi/Ra-One/movie-review/10484952.cms |accessdate=26 October 2011 |publisher=''The Times of India'' |date=26 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/66zo7REYQ?url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/movie-reviews/hindi/Ra-One/movie-review/10484952.cms |archivedate=17 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{Rating|3.5|5}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Movie review: ''Ra.One'' is a complete entertainer |url=http://www.ibtimes.com/articles/237156/20111025/ra-one-review-raone-review-bollywood-film-reviews-shah-rukh-khan-actress-kareena-kapoor-actor-arjun-.htm |accessdate=25 October 2011 |publisher=''[[International Business Times]]'' |date=25 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/677ArOjHB?url=http://www.ibtimes.com/articles/237156/20111025/ra-one-review-raone-review-bollywood-film-reviews-shah-rukh-khan-actress-kareena-kapoor-actor-arjun.htm |archivedate=22 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>}} Positive reviews described the film as an ambitious initiative and a technological success, with some critics thinking that ''Ra.One'' had put Indian films on par with Hollywood.<ref name="Rev2">{{cite web|title=''Ra.One'' mixed verdict: are the audiences divided? |url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/raone-mixed-verdict-are-the-audiences-divided/196748-8-66.html |accessdate=27 October 2011 |publisher=CNN-IBN |author=Vats, Rohit |date=27 October 2011 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/ra-one-movie-review/1/157516.html |publisher=''India Today'' |title=''Ra.One'' movie review |date=26 October 2011 |accessdate=26 October 2011 |author=Bamzai, Kaveri |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/66zosV9U6?url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/ra-one-movie-review/1/157516.html |archivedate=17 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{Rating|3.5|5}}</ref> The visual effects received near-universal praise, though dissenting opinions stated that they were "all over the place".<ref name="stunning">{{cite web|publisher=''Hindustan Times'' |author=Shekhar, Mayank |date=26 October 2011 |accessdate=26 October 2011 |title=Mayank Shekhar's review: ''Ra.One'' |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/News-Feed/mayankshekhar/Mayank-Shekhar-s-review-Ra-one/Article1-761677.aspx |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6778zXi3v?url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/News-Feed/mayankshekhar/Mayank-Shekhar-s-review-Ra-one/Article1-761677.aspx |archivedate=22 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{Rating|2|5}}</ref> The action sequences were also widely praised.<ref name="revv">{{cite news|url=http://www.mumbaimirror.com/article/30/20111027201110270206495966d26d5a4/RaTed-RaNdom-.html |title=Ra.Ted Ra.Ndom |date=27 October 2011 |publisher=''Mumbai Mirror'' |accessdate=27 October 2011 |author=Anshuman, Karan |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6779QAvTL?url=http://www.mumbaimirror.com/article/30/20111027201110270206495966d26d5a4/RaTed-RaNdom-.html |archivedate=22 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{Rating|2|5}}</ref><ref name="revf">{{cite web|url=http://www.firstpost.com/bollywood/movie-review-ra-one-is-a-good-one-in-more-ways-than-one-117330.html |publisher=''[[The First Post]]'' |title=Movie review: ''Ra.One'' is a Good.One, in more ways than one |date=26 October 2011 |accessdate=26 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/677AzDVgI?url=http://www.firstpost.com/bollywood/movie-review-ra-one-is-a-good-one-in-more-ways-than-one-117330.html |archivedate=22 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Other aspects of the film received more polarising opinions, and one very positive review was criticised for "over-rating" the film.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/movies/review/14208/index.html |author=Adarsh, Taran |publisher=Bollywood Hungama |title=''Ra.One'': movie review |date=24 October 2011 |accessdate=24 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/66znBHnqt?url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/moviemicro/cast/id/541043 |archivedate=17 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{Rating|4.5|5}}</ref> Mixed views were opined regarding the plot's gaming concept, with some critics deeming it "far-fetched" and others lauding the "gaming-style aesthetics".<ref name=Rev1 /><ref name="revc">{{cite news|author=Malani, Gaurav |url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/articleshow/10499290.cms |title=''Ra.One'': Movie review |date=26 October 2011 |accessdate=26 October 2011 |publisher=''The Economic Times'' |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6778chRFn?url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/articleshow/10499290.cms |archivedate=22 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{Rating|3|5}}</ref> Similarly, some critics called the emotional scenes "fulfilling" while others felt them to be "lacking in connect with the audience".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/ra-one-review-shah-rukh-khan-253499 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |title=''Ra.One'': film review |date=26 October 2011 |accessdate=26 October 2011 |author=Honeycutt, Kirk |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/677AMKc7G?url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/ra-one-review-shah-rukh-khan-253499 |archivedate=22 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/raone-review-srk-can-fail-too/20111027.htm |title=''Ra.One'' review: SRK can fail too |publisher=Rediff |date=27 October 2011 |accessdate=17 December 2011 |author=Sivaswamy, Sairesh |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6779ieOmG?url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/raone-review-srk-can-fail-too/20111027.htm |archivedate=22 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{Rating|1.5|5}}</ref>
The story was negatively received by several critics, with a number of them deeming it to be disappointing and lacking in originality;<ref name=revv /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://movies.ndtv.com/movie_Review.aspx?id=666 |author=Chatterjee, Saibal |publisher=NDTV |title=Review: ''Ra.One'' |accessdate=16 June 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120302171933/http://movies.ndtv.com/movie_Review.aspx?id=666 |archivedate= 2 March 2012 |df= }}{{Rating|3|5}}</ref> one critic praised the original idea but criticised its "Bollywoodization".<ref name=sss /> The direction was criticised in a number of reviews, though a few critics praised Sinha's pacing of the film and the execution of the action sequences.<ref name=revf /><ref name=revc /> Some critics pointed to the presence of scenes which were not child-friendly, despite ''Ra.One'' being promoted as a children's film.<ref>{{cite web|publisher=CNN-IBN |author=Masand, Rajeev |url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/diwali-cracker-raone-is-ambitious-but-flawed/196587-47-84.html |title=Masand: ''Ra.One'' is ambitious but flawed |date=26 October 2011 |accessdate=26 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6778gsqsd?url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/diwali-cracker-raone-is-ambitious-but-flawed/196587-47-84.html |archivedate=22 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{Rating|2.5|5}}</ref> Particular reviews criticised the lack of character development and the film's "incoherently hackneyed morality".<ref>{{cite web|title=3D review: ''Ra.One'' could have been so much more |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/review-raone-could-have-been-so-much-more/20111028.htm |date=28 October 2011 |publisher=Rediff |accessdate=28 October 2011 |author=Verma, Sukanya |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6778sjOQZ?url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/review-raone-could-have-been-so-much-more/20111028.htm |archivedate=22 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{Rating|2.5|5}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.movieweb.com/movie/ra-one/reviews/critic |title=''Ra.One'': critic reviews |publisher=Movie Web |accessdate=3 May 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67NpJSFQv?url=http://www.movieweb.com/movie/ra-one/reviews/critic |archivedate= 3 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{Rating|1|4}}</ref> A few critics panned the film as a whole, describing it as a "mess";<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/review-raone-arthur-pais/20111026.htm |title=Review: ''Ra.One'' disappoints New York |publisher=Rediff |date=26 October 2011 |accessdate=17 December 2011 |author=J Pais, Arthur |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67794QNjb?url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/review-raone-arthur-pais/20111026.htm |archivedate=22 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{Rating|2|5}}</ref> one review commented, "It's convenient to say that if you have no expectations from the film, you wouldn't be disappointed."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://in.movies.yahoo.com/blogs/movie-reviews/r-one-review-000920615.html |publisher=Yahoo! |title=''Ra.One'' review |author=Guha, Kunal |date=26 October 2011 |accessdate=26 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6779mDCxK?url=http://in.movies.yahoo.com/blogs/movie-reviews/r-one-review-000920615.html |archivedate=22 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
After its release, ''Ra.One'' received numerous nominations and awards in India and abroad, a majority of them for its technical aspects. The film notably won the [[National Film Award for Best Special Effects|National Film Award]] and the [[Filmfare Award for Best Special Effects|Filmfare Award]] for Best Special Effects,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-03-07/news-interviews/31131831_1_lyrics-award-chillar-party-nitesh-tiwari |title=Vidya Balan wins National Award for ''The Dirty Picture'' |publisher=''The Times of India'' |date=7 March 2012 |accessdate=7 March 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67ADrae55?url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-03-07/news-interviews/31131831_1_lyrics-award-chillar-party-nitesh-tiwari |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/photogallery/5751-27.html |title=Meet the winners of the 57th Filmfare Awards |publisher=CNN-IBN |accessdate=4 May 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67PfALtI3?url=http://ibnlive.in.com/photogallery/5751-27.html |archivedate= 4 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> and four [[International Indian Film Academy Awards]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://gulfnews.com/arts-entertainment/film/znmd-and-ra-one-dominate-iifa-tech-awards-1.1018146?localLinksEnabled=false |title=''ZNMD'' and ''Ra.One'' dominate IIFA tech awards |publisher=''Gulf News'' |date=5 May 2012 |accessdate=10 May 2012 |author=Radhakrishnan, Manjusha |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67YWlqDcK?url=http://gulfnews.com/arts-entertainment/film/znmd-and-ra-one-dominate-iifa-tech-awards-1.1018146?localLinksEnabled=false |archivedate=10 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The film also received several business awards for its marketing and distribution.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-01-27/news-interviews/30667165_1_actor-award-lyrics-award-story-award |publisher=''The Times of India'' |title=''Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara'' sweeps six Apsara awards |date=27 January 2012 |accessdate=6 March 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67ADym7dG?url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-01-27/news-interviews/30667165_1_actor-award-lyrics-award-story-award |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> On the other hand, the film received negative ("dishonorable") awards as well. ''Ra.One'' won the titles of Worst Film and Worst Director at the [[Golden Kela Awards]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/raone-named-worst-film-at-golden-kela-awards/245045-8-66.html |title=''Ra.One'' named worst film at Golden Kela awards |publisher=CNN-IBN |work=Press Trust of India |date=2 April 2012 |accessdate=4 April 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67AE1JcVn?url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/raone-named-worst-film-at-golden-kela-awards/245045-8-66.html |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> and also won the Worst Film award at the [[Ghanta Awards]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-03-20/news-interviews/31214083_1_salman-khan-worst-actor-ghanta-awards |title=Salman Khan named 'worst actor' at Ghanta Awards |publisher=''The Times of India'' |work=ANI |date=20 March 2012 |accessdate=4 April 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67AE49n7b?url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-03-20/news-interviews/31214083_1_salman-khan-worst-actor-ghanta-awards |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
==Economics==
===Pre-release=== The budget of ''Ra.One'' was the subject of significant speculation prior to its release. A number of estimates placed the budget between {{INRConvert|1.4|b}}<ref>{{cite web|url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/gallery/big-budget-films-of-2011/1/5519.html#photo5|title=Big budget films of 2011|publisher=''India Today''|accessdate=2 May 2012}}</ref> and {{INRConvert|2.0|b}}. It was universally accepted that the film was the most expensive Bollywood film of all time,<ref name=promdr /> with certain sources stating that the film was the most expensive Indian film ever.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1111026/jsp/calcutta/story_14669505.jsp |title=''Ra.One'' raises price bar at plexes; fans sing rah-rah ''Ra.One'' – city shows willingness to pay more for SRK's big Diwali release today |publisher=''The Telegraph'' |date=26 October 2011 |accessdate=10 April 2012 |author=Roy, Priyanka |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67A3TOfcQ?url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1111026/jsp/calcutta/story_14669505.jsp |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The original budget was revealed to be {{INRConvert|1.30|b}} after promotional expenses.<ref name=BOI>{{Cite web | title = Despite Rs 170cr income, RA.One not a hit? | work = [[Hindustan Times]] | date = 2 November 2011 |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/despite-rs-170cr-income-ra-one-not-a-hit/story-yw7lvEwuItuSwHIIBGpFyI.html}}</ref> Khan stated that he had "worked very hard" to finance the film without borrowing money,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-09-26/edit-page/30201105_1_raone-film-special-effects |title='Today, a Steven Spielberg is looking for investment from us' |publisher=''The Times of India'' |date=26 September 2011 |accessdate=3 May 2012 |author=Dubey, Bharti |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67NeDYepJ?url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-09-26/edit-page/30201105_1_raone-film-special-effects |archivedate= 3 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> and reportedly hosted a [[Zor Ka Jhatka: Total Wipeout|television show]] just to finance the film.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-11-21/tv/30425474_1_zor-ka-jhatka-game-show-shah-rukh-khan |title=Shahrukh Khan won't do ''Zor Ka Jhatka 2'' |publisher=''The Times of India'' |date=21 November 2011 |accessdate=3 May 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67Ne5DLAP?url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-11-21/tv/30425474_1_zor-ka-jhatka-game-show-shah-rukh-khan |archivedate= 3 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> ''Ra.One'' earned {{INRConvert|1.32|b}} from pre-release revenue sources, setting a new record for Bollywood films.<ref name="PRE">{{cite web|title=Shahrukh's ''Ra.One'' beats Aamir's ''3 Idiots'' in pre-release collection|url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/bollywood/features/2011/shahrukh-ra-one-aamir-3-idiots-pre-release-171011.html|date=17 October 2011|publisher=[[Oneindia.in]]}}</ref>
The extensive marketing campaign greatly increased audience expectations of the film. ''Ra.One'' set records for the level of pre-release buzz for a Bollywood film,<ref name=Marketing /> and also topped a number of polls gauging the most awaited Bollywood films of the year.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/anna-lokpal-bill-top-fb-status-updates-in-2011/210098-11.html |title=Anna, Jan Lokpal Bill top FB status updates in 2011 |publisher=CNN-IBN |date=9 December 2011 |accessdate=3 May 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67NiHwwWK?url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/anna-lokpal-bill-top-fb-status-updates-in-2011/210098-11.html |archivedate= 3 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mid-day.com/entertainment/2011/may/310511-informer-3.htm |title=''Ra.One'', ''Agneepath'' most eagerly awaited films: a recent poll |publisher=''Mid-Day'' |date=31 May 2011 |accessdate=20 April 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67ACbHqVj?url=http://www.mid-day.com/entertainment/2011/may/310511-informer-3.htm |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Anticipation for the film was equally high among the trade analysts, with some commenting that the film would pass the {{INRConvert|1|b}} mark in one week and the {{INRConvert|3|b}} mark in over three weeks.<ref name=Hint /> Advance bookings commenced on 20 October 2011 on a limited scale, and expanded later. While initial ticket sales were low,<ref name="boiadvance">{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3586&nCat |title=''Ra.One'' advance starts at select multiplexes |publisher=Box Office India |date=21 October 2011 |accessdate=11 April 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/66qL1l06a?url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3586&nCat |archivedate=11 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> they picked up considerably near the release date. A few days prior to the release, the advance booking was described as "phenomenal,"<ref name=boiadvance /> with an overall advance booking rate of 20–25% across the country.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3596&nCat= |title=''Ra.One'' advance: excellent |publisher=Box Office India |date=25 October 2011 |accessdate=11 April 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/66qLE99So?url=http://boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3596&nCat= |archivedate=11 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> A number of advantages of the film's release were pointed out, such as the festive season and higher 3D ticket prices, though there had been doubt regarding the timely release of the 3D version.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-10-25/news-interviews/30319815_1_special-3d-bookings-multiplex-owners |title=3D worries for the superhero |publisher=''The Times of India'' |work=Mumbai Mirror |date=25 October 2011 |accessdate=10 April 2012 |author=Sharma, Amrapali |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67A4cNjqw?url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-10-25/news-interviews/30319815_1_special-3d-bookings-multiplex-owners |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
===Box office=== {| class="wikitable" ! Territory ! Collections ! Reference |- | rowspan="2" | India | {{INRConvert|1.14|b}}{{ref |tenfig|**}} | rowspan="2" |<ref name="bonum">{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/arounddetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3935&nCat |title=Top lifetime nett grossers (all time) |publisher=Box Office India |date=17 January 2012 |accessdate=18 March 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67A5ZOIHd?url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/arounddetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3935&nCat |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://boxofficeindia.com/arounddetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=4241&nCat= |title=Top lifetime distributor shares (all time updated) 05/04/12 |publisher=Box Office India |date=5 April 2012 |accessdate=7 April 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67A5pwZk8?url=http://boxofficeindia.com/arounddetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=4241&nCat= |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> |- | ''Distributor share'':<br />{{INRConvert|636.1|m}}{{ref |tenfig|**}} |- | rowspan="2" | Overseas <small>''(Outside India)''</small> | $10.8 million | rowspan="2" |<ref name="BOI"/> |- | $2,511,689 <small>''(United States–Canada)''</small> |- | rowspan="2" |'''Worldwide''' | {{INRConvert|2.02|b}}{{ref |tenfig|**}} | rowspan="2" |<ref name="BOI"/><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/arounddetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3997&nCat= |publisher=Box Office India |title=Top worldwide grossers (all time): 37 films hit Rs. 100 crore |date=3 February 2012 |accessdate=3 February 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/66qLNWP9W?url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/arounddetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3997&nCat= |archivedate=11 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> |- | ''With dubbed versions'':<br />{{INRConvert|2.07|b}}<sup>'''{{ref |elevenfig|%}}'''</sup> |- ! colspan="4" | Symbols |- style="background: #FAF0BE;" | colspan="5" style="text-align:center;"| {{note label|ninefig|*|}} For 2011 Bollywood releases only; {{note label|tenfig|**|}} Hindi version only; {{note label|elevenfig|%|}} Estimate |}
In India, ''Ra.One'' debuted at the beginning of the five-day [[Diwali]] weekend, and subsequently broke the Diwali opening day record.<ref>{{cite web |title=''Ra.One'' nets highest ever Diwali day collections |url=http://movies.ndtv.com/movie_story.aspx?ID=ENTEN20110186868&keyword=bollywood&subcatg=MOVIESINDIA&nid=144581 |accessdate=28 October 2011 |publisher=NDTV |date=28 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67A5kzB3y?url=http://movies.ndtv.com/movie_story.aspx?ID=ENTEN20110186868&keyword=bollywood&subcatg=MOVIESINDIA&nid=144581 |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The film then set the records for the biggest single-day net revenue and the biggest three-day opening weekend earned by a Bollywood film, breaking the previous records held by ''Bodyguard''.<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3619 |publisher = Box Office India |title = ''Ra.One'' second day territorial breakdown |date = 28 October 2011 |accessdate = 28 October 2011 |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/67A5Ds4bU?url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3619 |archivedate = 24 April 2012 |deadurl = yes |df = }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.boxofficeindia.com/arounddetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=4013&nCat= |publisher = Box Office India |title = Top opening weekends (all time) ''Agneepath'' 5th |date = 7 February 2012 |accessdate = 5 March 2012 |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/67A5GWCn0?url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/arounddetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=4013&nCat= |archivedate = 24 April 2012 |deadurl = yes |df = }}</ref>
Subsequently, the film began to suffer significant drops in its collections, with its five-day extended weekend and nine-day extended week coming second to the records of ''Bodyguard''.<ref name="fweekex">{{cite web |title=''Ra.One'' (Hindi) has good extended first week |url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3649 |date=4 November 2011 |publisher=Box Office India |accessdate=4 November 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67A5MqmLm?url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3649 |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The film faced an 84 percent drop in collections in its second week and fell a further 90 percent in its third week, the latter primarily due to the release of ''[[Rockstar (2011 film)|Rockstar]]''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3675&nCat= |title=''Ra.One'' has 15.50 crore nett second week |publisher=Box Office India |date=11 November 2011 |accessdate=30 May 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6835lAP72?url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3675&nCat= |archivedate=30 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3701&nCat= |title=''Ra.One'' has heavy fall in week three |publisher=Box Office India |date=16 November 2011 |accessdate=30 May 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6835o1dkt?url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3701&nCat= |archivedate=30 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The dubbed versions showed similar trends.<ref name=fweekex /> The Tamil and Telugu versions together earned around {{INRConvert|50|m}} nett.<ref name="BOI"/>
In overseas markets, ''Ra.One'' earned the highest three-day and five-day opening weekends among the Bollywood releases of 2011;<ref>{{cite web |url=http://boxofficeindia.com/arounddetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=4065&nCat= |title=Top openings overseas (all time updated) 21/02/12 |publisher=Box Office India |date=21 February 2012 |accessdate=7 April 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67A5vplq0?url=http://boxofficeindia.com/arounddetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=4065&nCat= |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/overdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3643&nCat= |title=''Ra.One'' has huge opening in overseas and is biggest hit of 2011 |publisher=Box Office India |date=2 November 2011 |accessdate=30 May 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/68359clra?url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/overdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3643&nCat= |archivedate=30 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> by its second weekend, the film had become the highest-grossing Bollywood film of 2011 in overseas markets, but the collections suffered drops throughout.<ref>{{cite web |title=''Ra.One'' falls in overseas but number one of 2011 |url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/overdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3669 |date=9 November 2011 |publisher=Box Office India |accessdate=9 November 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/66qLfefCU?url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/overdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=3669 |archivedate=11 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> In general, families and children formed the major portion of the film's audience,<ref>{{cite web|title=Family powers ''Ra.One'' on day I |url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1111027/jsp/frontpage/story_14672596.jsp |accessdate=27 October 2011 |publisher=''[[The Telegraph (Calcutta)|The Telegraph]]'' |date=27 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67A5VsC2p?url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1111027/jsp/frontpage/story_14672596.jsp |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> and the 3D version is regarded as a success.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2011-11-07/news/30369552_1_scrabble-entertainment-ranjit-thakur-first-3d-film |title=After ''Ra.One'' success Bollywood gears up for more shorter films in 3D |publisher=''The Economic Times'' |date=7 November 2011 |accessdate=3 May 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67O0NvPWz?url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2011-11-07/news/30369552_1_scrabble-entertainment-ranjit-thakur-first-3d-film |archivedate= 3 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
==Possible sequel== {{quote box|quote="A film like this requires a year-and-a-half of pre-production, so it's impossible for me to give you a time frame. I'm unsure if it'll even get made or if I'll use the technology in some other genre [...] I know it is going to be expensive, but perhaps the next film would be cheaper since I now have the technology."|source=—Khan, on the possible release of a sequel<ref name="seq">{{cite web|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/Wanted-story-for-G-One/Article1-823759.aspx |title=Wanted: story for ''G.One'' |publisher=''Hindustan Times'' |date=11 March 2012 |accessdate=28 April 2012 |author1=Bhattacharya, Roshmila |author2=Saini, Minakshi |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67GddAxew?url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/Wanted-story-for-G-One/Article1-823759.aspx |archivedate=28 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>|align=right|width=25em}} Reports of a planned sequel of ''Ra.One'' began surfacing prior to the film's release, though the extent of real progress on the sequel is unknown. Both Khan and Sinha admitted to formulating plans for a sequel, though the former noted that it would be "presumptuous" to start the sequel before the first film's release.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/SRK-planning-to-make-RA-One-sequel/Article1-754168.aspx |title=SRK planning to make ''Ra.One'' sequel |publisher=''Hindustan Times'' |date=6 October 2011 |accessdate=4 April 2012 |author=Mehta, Shweta |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67AE7LzBn?url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/SRK-planning-to-make-RA-One-sequel/Article1-754168.aspx |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Khan later refuted the speculations, saying that a sequel was unlikely due to his other commitments.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-11-05/news-interviews/30363639_1_raone-superhero-film-sequel |title=No plans for ''Ra.One'' sequel: SRK |publisher=''The Times of India'' |date=5 November 2011 |accessdate=4 April 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67AEBgGhx?url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-11-05/news-interviews/30363639_1_raone-superhero-film-sequel |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> After ''Ra.One'' won a National Award, an "overjoyed" Khan said that the film's world could be further explored. He stated that the sequel, if made, would be titled ''G.One'' and not ''Ra.Two'', and that he would make it "faster, bigger and better" than ''Ra.One''.<ref name="rrr">{{cite web|url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/srk-planning-ra-one-sequel_99393.htm |title=SRK planning ''Ra.One'' sequel? |publisher=Zee News |date=2 November 2011 |accessdate=4 April 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67AEGpu0m?url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/srk-planning-ra-one-sequel_99393.htm |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Khan was reported to be looking for a script, without a fixed release date.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/Shah-Rukh-Khan-game-for-RA-One-sequel/Article1-823234.aspx |title=Shahrukh Khan game for ''Ra.One'' sequel |publisher=''Hindustan Times'' |date=10 March 2012 |accessdate=4 April 2012 |author=Bhattacharya, Roshmila |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67AEEHIES?url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/Shah-Rukh-Khan-game-for-RA-One-sequel/Article1-823234.aspx |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> In April 2012, Mushtaq Sheikh said that the pre-production of the sequel had begun.<ref name="rrr" /> A number of reports stated that Kareena Kapoor would not be a part of the sequel.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-12-07/news-interviews/30482229_1_raone-sequel-chammak-challo |title=Kareena Kapoor will not be a part of ''Ra.One'' sequel |publisher=''The Times of India'' |date=7 December 2011 |accessdate=4 April 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67AEJcYVM?url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-12-07/news-interviews/30482229_1_raone-sequel-chammak-challo |archivedate=24 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
Despite Khan's enthusiasm for the idea of a sequel, the film industry expressed mixed opinions regarding it. Filmmaker [[Rajkumar Gupta]] commented, "It would be challenging to take forward a story that has not worked earlier." Producer [[Ramesh Taurani]] responded negatively to the idea, saying, "It is important for the film to be appreciated so that a sequel can be made." Trade analyst Atul Mohan called the sequel "a bad idea." Conversely, others were supportive of the sequel. Producer [[Goldie Behl]] brushed aside arguments about the success of the first film, saying, "If the people think that they can earn some more, then it doesn't matter how big or small the hit was." Director [[Kunal Kohli]] also reacted positively, saying, "Certain ideas naturally lend themselves to sequels. So why not use that investment of your time and effort to make a sequel that will take the brand further?"<ref name="seq" /> {{Clear}}

{{about|the American arts presenter|the Australian footballer|Rachel_Cooper_(footballer)}} {{peacock|date=June 2013}}
'''Rachel Cooper''' (April 20, 1954) is an American performing arts presenter specializing in [[cultural exchange]]. She is the Director of Global Performing Arts and Cultural Initiatives for the Asia Society,<ref>{{cite web|author=Asia Society Our People Contact Us |url=http://asiasociety.org/new-york/about/our-people |title=Our People | New York |publisher=Asia Society |date= |accessdate=2013-06-10}}</ref> and prior to joining the Asia Society she headed the Festival of Indonesia <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2010/03/23/rachel-cooper-indonesia-flowing-through-her-veins.html |title=Rachel Cooper: Indonesia flowing through her veins |publisher=The Jakarta Post |date=2010-03-23 |accessdate=2013-06-10}}</ref> which brought over 200 artists to 30 states in the United States. Along with [[I Wayan Suweca]] and [[Michael Tenzer]], she co-founded [[Gamelan Sekar Jaya]] which was the first community-based [[Balinese gamelan]] in the [[United States]].
== Career == [[Rachel Ann Cooper]] lived in [[Indonesia]] from 1983–88, teaching English while participating in performance at [[Taman Ismail Marzuki]]. In 1985 she helped organize Gamelan Sekar Jaya’s first tour to Indonesia.<ref>{{cite web|last=Campbell |first=Brett |url=http://www.sfcv.org/article/american-gamelans-pioneering-flower-still-in-full-bloom |title=American Gamelan’s Pioneering Flower Still in Full Bloom : San Francisco Classical Voice |publisher=Sfcv.org |date=2011-08-15 |accessdate=2013-06-10}}</ref> The group had been invited to perform in the [[Bali Arts Festival]] in [[Denpasar]] and would continue to performance in six other cities including [[Jogjakarta]], in [[Central Java]]. After returning to the United States, Cooper coordinated the Performing Arts program of the [[Festival of Indonesia]] from 1990 to 91.
She has worked at the [[Asia Society]] since 1993 and has produced and presented over 300 performances, tours and commissioned artists. She has worked with many of the premiere cultural institutions in the United States. Among the many projects she has produced are [[Creative Voices of Muslim Asia]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://asiasociety.org/arts/creative-voices-muslim-asia |title=Creative Voices of Muslim Asia |publisher=Asia Society |date= |accessdate=2013-06-10}}</ref> Chorus Repertory Theater of Manipur,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://asiasociety.org/media/press-releases/ratan-thiyams-chorus-repertory-theatre-returns-us-five-city-tour-this-fall |title=Ratan Thiyam's Chorus Repertory Theatre Returns to the U.S. for Five-City Tour This Fall |publisher=Asia Society |date=2006-10-11 |accessdate=2013-06-10}}</ref> Dance the Spirit of Cambodia,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://asiasociety.org/arts/performing-arts/dance/proueng-chhieng-and-spirit-cambodia |title=Proueng Chhieng and the Spirit of Cambodia |publisher=Asia Society |date= |accessdate=2013-06-10}}</ref> Nan Jombang,<ref>{{cite web|author=<!--paging_filter-->About the Author |url=http://asiasociety.org/blog/asia/interview-rachel-cooper-indonesias-envelope-pushing-dance-troupe |title=Interview: Rachel Cooper on Indonesia's Envelope-Pushing Dance Troupe |publisher=Asia Society |date=2012-09-20 |accessdate=2013-06-10}}</ref> Shahram and Hafez Nazeri in the Path of Rumi,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.payvand.com/news/06/oct/1295.html |title=A Soul of Asia Program: In The Path of Rumi (concert in New York) |publisher=Payvand.com |date= |accessdate=2013-06-10}}</ref>
Cooper has presented and curated film programs from [[India]], Indonesia, [[China]], [[Iran]], [[Japan]], [[Korea]] and [[Thailand]], as well as producing and presenting performances from throughout Asia. She has co-sponsored and presented various [[film festival]]s and film series at the Asia Society, including the Iranian Documentary and Short Film Festival, the Asian American International Film Festival and the IAAC India Film Festival, among others. She has organized major arts and culture initiatives, including Festival of Song: Music of India and Pakistan. In addition, she has conducted and published research on international impact of the arts, which resulted in the report Making a Difference through the Arts. In 2006 she was awarded the [[Dawson Award]] for Sustained Excellence in Arts Programming.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://asiasociety.org/about/people/experts#cooper |title=Fellows & Experts |publisher=Asia Society |date= |accessdate=2013-06-10}}</ref>

revision.text:
{{Primary sources|date=January 2011}} <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Robopet.jpg|thumb|right|256px|Robopet]] --> The '''Robopet''' is a [[robotic]] dog produced by [[Wow Wee|WowWee]] that is based on the [[biomorphic]] work of [[Mark Tilden|Mark W. Tilden]]. The Robopet has IR, audio and tilt [[sensors]] and is able to wander around [[autonomous]]ly detecting and reacting to objects and sounds. It also performs random 'tricks' such as howling, begging, rolling over and playing dead.
== Hardware and software == The Robopet has 5 equal custom [[gearboxes]] using 2 and 3 bit position [[switches]]. The robot runs from a single [[Microprocessor|processor]] [[Circuit Board|board]] in its back and is controlled by autonomous routines and IR ([[Infrared]]) [[Signal (electronics)|signals]] from a thirteen button [[remote control]]. The [[CPU]] is a custom-designed 16bit [[RISC]] processor with 512k of built in sound and 12k of program space and 128 bytes of onboard RAM.
The [[software]] code is 12k of [[assembly language]] based around an [[operating system]] written in the 1980s by the inventor, Mark Tilden. The robopet operates on 4 batteries, while the remote needs 3 batteries.
== Features and tricks == When left by itself for a few seconds, the Robopet enters its autonomous mode and starts exploring the room, responding to I/R reflected signals from objects and the floor.
The tricks that Robopet performs are: roll over, play dead, howl, paw, relief, jump, "whoops", rock and scratch. These can be activated by the user via the remote control and are [[randomly]] performed by the Robopet when in its autonomous mode.
The Robopet also features an edge-detection mode which has to be either on or off via the power switch, so it can be placed on a table without falling off.
The 2 axis tilt internal sensor detects whether the robot has fallen over, and it can automatically right itself.
==Colors and special editions== Robopet is available in yellow ,white, pink, blue, purple, and black. A special "Signature Series" [[Sharper Image]] edition was released, sporting a metallic red color. Furthermore, a special "Bulldog" version, sporting a re-sculpted head and painted on eyes, was created for sale at [[RadioShack]] stores.
In 2007, after the release of new robots, RoboPets were repackaged to include Mini RoboPets. The Mini RoboPets wind-up and walk.
(Problems) RoboPets are extremely Fragile, Legs easily fall off or the plastic chips and breaks over time. Gearboxes were easily Jammed up. On the First edition of roboPet the legs were protected just by springs so the legs would fall off
== Programming == Like the other WowWee products to date, the Robopet can be [[Computer program|programmed]]. It has 9 remote-control accessible tricks and 5 direction functions (forward, backward, left, right, and stop) which can be sequentially placed into a 20 step program.
It also features "Good Dog" and "Bad Dog" buttons which either encourages or discourages it from performing recent "tricks".
== External links == {{Portal|Robotics}} *[http://www.robopetonline.com/ WowWee Robopet's Official Home on the Web] *[http://www.theoldrobots.com/images7b/Robopet_Manual.pdf Robopet's Official Manual] *[http://www.robocommunity.com/category/13/Robopet Robopet Home] on [http://www.robocommunity.com RoboCommunity] - The official WowWee Robotics user community *[http://www.robosapien.tk/ Unofficial WowWee Hacks and Mods site] *[http://www.robocommunity.com/article/10298/Evolution-of-the-Robopet/ The Evolution of the Robopet] (in pictures)
